Description_Cause: Correct water level (24.6kHz) is not reached within 8 minutes after water is supplied or it does not reach the preset water level within 20 minutes.
The load is too small. The appliance is tilted. Laundry is gathered to one side. Non-distributable things are put into the drum.
Water is overflowing (water level frequency is over 21.3kHz). If FE is displayed the drain pump will operate to drain the water automatically.
The PRESSURE SENSOR ASSEMBLY is out of order. When water level frequency is consistently below 10 kHz or over 30 kHz.
Door not all the way closed. Loose electrical connections at door switch and PWB Assembly. The DOOR SWITCH ASSEMBLY is out of order.
The THERMISTOR is out of order.
The connector (3-pin male white) in the MOTOR HARNESS is not connected to the connector of STATOR ASSEMBLY. Bad or unstable electric contact between connectors. MOTOR HARNESS is cut (open circuited).
EEPROM is out of order. Displayed only when the START/PAUSE button is first pressed in the Load Test Mode.
Power supply interruption while machine is working.
If the washing machine detects too many suds it displays this error code and adds Suds Reducing cycle.
